title: magnusl
author: magnusl
content: Hi!Does anyone here know of a place called bitcoingate, bcgatig.vip? I have been introduced to this place by a trader, but I feel unsure whether this is a serious place or not. Any advice?Magnus

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: The website you are referring to is down now and I don't know what they are offering. But whatever they do, I wouldn't trust them. Their domain has been registered only 39 days ago.  Quote from: domaintoolsDates   39 days oldCreated on 2022-07-06Expires on 2023-07-06Updated on 2022-07-11

comments.author: magnusl
comments.body: Hi!Hrm... I can access it?https://www.bcgatig.vip/andhttps://www.bcgatep.vip/THe latter also registered only 39 days ago?How about crypto.com then?Magnus

comments.author: hosemary
comments.created_time: August 14, 2022, 10:15:43 AMLast edit: August 14, 2022, 10:35:40 AM by hosseinimr93
comments.body: Quote from: magnusl on August 14, 2022, 09:50:18 AMHrm... I can access it?You can't access it. The website is down for everyone.Quote from: magnusl on August 14, 2022, 09:50:18 AMTHe latter also registered only 39 days ago?It has been registered 43 days ago and it's probably a scam. Quote from: domaintoolsDates   43 days oldCreated on 2022-07-02Expires on 2023-07-02Updated on 2022-07-07Quote from: magnusl on August 14, 2022, 09:50:18 AMHow about crypto.com then?I haven't ever used this website, but there are so many negative reviews on trustpilot.

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: Quote from: magnusl on August 14, 2022, 08:59:31 AMHi!Does anyone here know of a place called bitcoingate, bcgatig.vip? I have been introduced to this place by a trader, but I feel unsure whether this is a serious place or not. Any advice?One month old domain, claiming millions of users, claiming to be founded in 2013 and with offices in 84 countries and 3 billion in cold storage?There is no exchange in this world with that many offices in the first place!And that app with no links to google play but with 20k reviews, of course, it's nothing fishy at all.The "trader" is most likely a scammer who will trick you into depositing BTC on this website and then he will go deaf on all your other requests, except for the moment he will ask you for money to pay for cashing in your "winnings".

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Here's a tip: Only use the already-reputable exchange platforms. You don't have a single reason in trying to test out random platforms (especially in the finance category where you deposit money) that are unheard of.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: magnusl on August 14, 2022, 08:59:31 AMDoes anyone here know of a place called bitcoingate, bcgatig.vip? I have been introduced to this place by a trader, but I feel unsure whether this is a serious place or not. Any advice?You actually got advice from a scammer, not from any trader - because those real traders don't give advice on social networks, but trade and make a profit. My advice would be to stop listening to the advice of unknown people on social networks, because first they will advise you to visit links like the ones you mentioned, and if you don't get caught in that trap, you will get a much more dangerous link that will contain malware or something similar.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: I would be very cautious when some random stranger told you they were a trader out of nowhere, or in social media sites. Unless you posted on socmed or forums asking for help for trading. Particularly if they introduce a website they called an exchanged. Always use google to check the website and make a google search "site_name review" to give you insights of what kind of website is this, check the website's social media handles, forums thread or reddit for reviews too.
